results.title: Travelling North (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ben Gannon, View Pictures and Carl Schultz
results.brief_description:
‘Travelling North’ (adapted for the screen by David Williamson from his award winning play) is the story of one man’s struggle to retain his dignity in the face of adversity. Leo McKern plays Frank, a crotchety old man who has an unending zest and passion for life. Julia Blake is Frances, his much younger companion who watches helplessly as Frank enters a traumatic period in his life - unable to understand the complexity of his personality and his strong desire to live life to the fullest.
Cast also includes: Graham Kennedy as Freddy, Henri Szeps as Saul, Michele Fawdon as Helen, Diane Craig as Sophie, Andrea Moor as Joan, Drew Forsythe as Martin, and John Gregg as Jim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ben Gannon, View Pictures and Carl Schultz

results.title: Travelling man
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
Samuel Bourne, a nineteenth century British pioneer was a travelling photographer. His photographic records of exotic places reveal life in India and Kashmir in the 1860’s and 1870’s.

results.title: Travelling in Yugoslavia
results.creator_credit: Ian Hamilton, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Helen Canu
results.brief_description: Until very recently Yugoslavia was a popular tourist destination. This documentary reveals the beauty of the land with its ski resorts, beautiful coastal towns on the Adriatic coast, breath-taking mountain scenery in the Plitvice Lake region and the splendour of structures like the historic Kalamegdan fortress in the heart of Belgrade. The video takes us to Zagreb, Ljubljana, Plitvice, Dubrovnik, Sarajevo, Bled, Mostar and Belgrade.

results.title: Travelling in Singapore
results.creator_credit: Alex Creshi, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: With a population of 2.5 million, this former British colony is renowned as the cleanest place in Asia. Famous for its international hotel, Raffles, it’s large harbour and its shopping, Singapore is full of life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Creshi, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Tony Chenn

results.title: Travelling in Korea with Silvio Rivier
results.creator_credit: Tony Chenn, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Alec Ceschi
results.brief_description: SBS presenter Silvio Rivier hosts these two programs on the tourist delights of Korea, “Land of morning calm”. Each program begins in Seoul, now the fourth largest city of the world and shows the enormous contrast between the old and the new, in the ancient palaces and the modern shopping centres. The first program also visits the Korean folk village near Seoul, Mt. Sorak National Park on the north coast and Kyongju, the ancient Korean capital. The second program visits the town of Pusan and Cheju Island, honeymoon capital of Asia.

results.title: Travelling in China: Through the Open Door
results.brief_description: From the grandeur of Tien-An Men Square in the centre of Beijing to the elaborate marble boat and richness of the Summer Palace at Quinhuayuan, and the awesome history of the Forbidden Palace, this is an eyecatching travelogue. With Australians now third highest on the list of tourists who visit China, this video is a must for anyone wishing to visit China or learn more about the country.

results.title: Travellers' tales: survey south
results.brief_description: Shows the scientific survey of the South Sandwich Islands carried out by the British Antarctic Survey expedition and the Royal Navy in 1964. Includes aspects of the zoological, botanical and surveying work undertaken.

results.title: Travel tips
results.creator_credit: David McKenzie and Associated Television International
results.brief_description: Noted travel expert Laura Mckenzie takes us to various tourist destinations around the world. As well as suggesting places to visit, she also gives tips on clothing, climate, local customs, prices, accomodation, opening hours, etc.

results.title: Travel log
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description:
A film of mystery set in a world of limbo: the world of the road. This travel album and diary—photographs on the screen, plus a woman’s words—tell the story of a couple who drifts apart, of a journey with no return. An introspective, haunting mood piece about intimacy and dispossession.
(Awards: Cracow; Cork; Melbourne; Yorkton)

results.title: Travel fantasies
results.brief_description: The ultimate travel fantasy begins with a gondola ride in Venice and ends on a cruise ship in the Pacific. In between, the armchair traveller can take a hot air balloon ride in France, fly Concorde with Lauren Bacall, see the snow covered Mount Batchelor or the world from the cockpit of an American Fighter Plane. A more sedate time can be had riding an elephant on a South African safari. This video documents the ultimate in around-the-world travel.
